pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we study the behaviour of cochains (of the complex of homomorphisms) with respect to shifts (on the target). In particular, we obtain an additive equivalence `rightShiftAddEquiv K L n a n' h : Cochain K L n â‰ƒ+ Cochain K LâŸ¦aâŸ§ n'` when `n' + a = n`.

---

A similar PR shall be necessary for the study of the shift on the source, but that will be more intricate as there will be signs in the definitions...

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7379990379/job/20076871594)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7379990379/job/20076871507)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (x â€¢ Î³).rightShift a n' hn' = x â€¢ Î³.rightShift a n' hn' := by ```

Please consider moving this up a bit higher. And then you can deduce all the lemmas about preserving `0` and `-` etc, by just restating the goal in terms of this AddEquiv, and applying some generic `map_zero` or `map_neg` lemma.

Also... should this even be upgraded to a linear equiv?
Thanks for the suggestion! I have deduced the lemmas that can be deduced from the additive equivalence, and I have also made a linear equivalence version.
